text:
Sport & Leisure are planning a big Sports Alumni event in November to celebrate the 125 year anniversary of City, University of London. 

If you are an Alumni of City, University of London and would like to receive information about this event, please could you fill in the newly updated Alumni form, which now allows you to input which sports you participated in during your time at the university. 

https://www.city.ac.uk/alumni/update-your-details  

You can also join our City, University of London Sports Alumni page to keep up to date on all things sport related happening at the university. To join, follow the link below 

https://www.facebook.com/search/top/?q=city%20university%20of%20london%20sport%20alumni&epa=SEARCH_BOX 

More details about the event will follow......

fullName: City, University of London Library Services
text:
In 2016, City Law School‚Äôs Nikki Walsh and the Johannesburg-based legal NGO Socio-Economic Rights Institute (SERI) obtained funding to run a free four-day courtroom skills course for young South African human rights lawyers who have had little training in advocacy, but face well-trained opponents in court when representing disadvantaged clients. 
Watch this 10 minute documentary film: https://youtu.be/LH56zS0P0_U
linkedText:

text:
"There were people there who could be passing you in the street, dressed just like you or me ... however they can‚Äôt afford to feed themselves, old and young."

A team of City Sight optometry staff and students recently took part in a free community kitchen for the homeless. The kitchen is run by the Nishkam SWAT (Sikh Welfare Awareness Team) charity, and looks to provide food to anyone regardless of religion, caste, colour, creed, age, gender, or social status.

You can read more about the staff and students' experiences, and learn more about Nishkam SWAT, here: https://www.city.ac.uk/news/2019/may/city-sight-staff-students-in-nishkam-swat-initiative-help-homeless
linkedText:

You can read more about the staff and students' experiences, and learn more about Nishkam SWAT, here: https://www.city.ac.uk/news/2019/may/city-sight-staff-students-in-nishkam-swat-initiative-help-homeless

text:
The MadeAtUni 'Nation‚Äôs Lifesavers' campaign has launched today, and we're delighted that one of our very own research collaborations has been featured!

Co-led by Jane Marshall, Professor of Aphasiology and Stephanie Wilson, Professor of Human-Computer Interaction, the City, University of London collaboration has developed numerous technologies to help people with the language disorder, aphasia.

Aphasia is a complex disorder of language and communication caused by damage to the brain, and is usually caused by a stroke. About a third of people who have a stroke are affected, with many experiencing social isolation, reduced well-being and poor quality of life as a result.

Find out more about their amazing work and how they feel about being recognised in this way here: https://www.city.ac.uk/news/2019/may/city-language-and-tech-collaboration-featured-in-madeatuni-campaign
linkedText:

Aphasia is a complex disorder of language and communication caused by damage to the brain, and is usually caused by a stroke. About a third of people who have a stroke are affected, with many experiencing social isolation, reduced well-being and poor quality of life as a result.

text:
Happy #InternationalNursesDay ! We want to celebrate by sharing some of the amazing (and diverse!) work that our nursing graduates are doing on a daily basis, including heading up healthcare within the justice system, serving as Captain Nurse Officer for the British army and working as an Endocrine Nurse Specialist at a gender identity clinic!

You can learn more about their work, and its importance, on our nursing alumni page: https://www.city.ac.uk/people/alumni#meta_L_orsand=%22Nursing%22

text:
From welcoming the world to the Northampton Institute (now City University) for the 1908 Olympics to sending students out in the world in the 1950s, City can truly say its international roots date back to its very foundation üåç

As we celebrate our 125th anniversary this year, we take a look back over the vibrant and engaged global community which plays a special part in City's history ‚û°Ô∏è http://ow.ly/4GFF50ufP5u

#City125

text:
‚ÄúStarting a business is exciting, at the beginning you only really concentrate on the positive side of things. You don‚Äôt ever realise the problems until you encounter them and that is when mental health issues can come about." üí≠ 

- Tom Hewitson (MA City Journalism 2010 and CEO of Labworks, Europe‚Äôs largest voice game developer) has called for young business owners to be mindful of their mental health.

With 45 student businesses in City Launch Lab (City‚Äôs start-up incubation space that supports students and graduates who want to set up their own business) a newly launched wellbeing and mental health service will support City‚Äôs resident founders at the earliest and most vulnerable stage of their journeys.

Read more ‚û°Ô∏è http://ow.ly/JYjo50ufNrJ

#MentalHealthAwarenessWeek

text:
Join the Digital Leadership Research Centre at Cass Business School on Thursday 13th June, when it will host a panel event titled: Retail In The New Digital Ecosystem - Winners & Losers. 

The event will focus on identifying patterns of value creation in the new ecosystem. It aims to help participants gain a better understanding of how different stakeholders, in the broader retail value chain, maximise the benefits and minimise the pitfalls of digital transformation.

Don‚Äôt miss out! Book your place here: http://bit.ly/2VNkAJ2

text:
There is still time to book your places for our upcoming Real Estate events in London on Wednesday 22nd May.

Cass Real Estate Club Conference:
The Club's flagship event will focus on Global Investment Strategy and its keynote speakers will address a range of topics including global capital flows, innovation in the property sector, high-net-worth versus institutional investment strategies and property development.
Register here: http://bit.ly/2PSxXSM 

Real Estate Alumni Dinner: 
Come along to the Annual Dinner, which will be an excellent opportunity to reunite with your former classmates, and meet other alumni who also completed your course and work in the real estate industry. 
Register here: http://bit.ly/2H8FidW

text:
Hoping to further your career in supply chain management or global logistics? Then University of London's new online MSc programme might be for you. 

The Supply Chain Management and Global Logistics course will advance your career skills, as you will gain an in-depth perspective of global supply chains and develop the strategic and analytical tools to manage them.

10% discount available for all alumni!

Apply here: http://bit.ly/2HksCAO  

https://youtu.be/NF1Xe7-NB3o

text:
Join our next EntrepreneursTalk@Cass event, where Axel Threlfall, Reuters Editor-at-Large, will interview two innovative and inspirational entrepreneurs, Emily Brooke MBE, founder of Beryl, and Martin Mignot, partner at Index Ventures. 

Emily will share her journey since starting her business, while Martin will provide an insight into how he supports his portfolio of startups. 

Date: Wednesday 5th June 
Registration: http://bit.ly/2W4UzVz 

There are free early bird tickets available until Monday 20th May, so don‚Äôt miss out!
